posts.post_content: Stop complaining, folks. Any hard counterspell that can be played for free is pretty good. Besides, the fact that you can play it while tapped out and then easily reset three lands makes it custom-made for use with [Winter Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winter Orb) or even [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis).

posts.post_content: I run this in my MUC deck, and while it *is* rough on your tempo early-game, but it's pretty sweet mid-game if you've been hitting all your land-drops. It's nice to drop [Sphinx of Jwar Isle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of Jwar Isle) turn six and know I've still got this waiting in the wings. Not a 5/5 but it's far from the worst counterspell Wizards has made.

posts.post_content:
Big brother of [Daze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Daze) :D  
  
Aside from its use in [Stasis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stasis) decks, this might combine nicely with [Magus of the Library](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Magus of the Library).  
Yeah, it throws you back a lot and you need 5 cards in hand(and 3 islands on the field) before casting this to work, but green also has cards like [Exploration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exploration) after all.
posts.html:
